attributes.action: Make homophobia & homophobic language in schools have more severe consequences
attributes.additional_details:
Stonewall have really given us an insight to homophobia within secondary schools and I've learnt a lot from their website. 
http://www.stonewall.org.uk/get-involved/education/secondary-schools
attributes.background: I hear the phrase 'that's so gay' on a daily basis and I'm sick of young people using others sexualities as an insult . It is a form of bullying and many don't realise how it can effect an LGB youth. I want to raise awareness in schools and help teachers to notice and do something about it.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Disciplinary procedures in schools are a matter for individual schools and not the UK Government and Parliament as a whole. You could start a petition calling on the Government to introduce guidelines for schools on how to deal with homophobia.
